title: of giving further effect to Regulation EU 2017/746 of the European Parliament
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (National
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (National 
Research Ethics Committees for Performance Studies of In Vitro Diagnostic 
Medical Devices) (Amendment) Regulations 2023. 

(2) The European Union (National Research Ethics Committees for 
Performance Studies of In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices) Regulations 
2022 (S.I. 257 of 2022) and these Regulations may be cited together as the 
European Union (National Research Ethics Committees for Performance 
Studies of In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices) Regulations 2022 and 2023.

title: of giving further effect to Regulation EU 2017/746 of the European Parliament
heading: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation
text_raw:
4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation 
35 (as amended by the European Union (National Research Ethics Committees 
for Performance Studies of 
In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 725 of 2022)) the following: 

“Fees
text_norm: 4 principal regulation amended substituting regulation 35 (as amended european union (national research ethic committee performance study vitro diagnostic medical devices) (amendment) regulation 2022 (s.i no 725 2022)) following fee

title: of giving further effect to Regulation EU 2017/746 of the European Parliament
heading: 35. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the following fees shall be payable
text_raw:
35. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the following fees shall be payable 
by a sponsor to the National Office: 

(a) 

€1,500 in respect of each application for National REC 
review relating to the conduct of a performance study in 
the State, 

1 OJ No. L 117, 5.5.2017, p. 176. 
2 OJ L 80, 20.3.2023, p. 24. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [670] 3 

(b) 

 €300 in respect of each application for National REC 
review of a substantial modification of a performance 
study, and 

(c) 

€1,200 in respect of each appeal under Regulation 24 
(which fee shall be refundable if the appeal is successful). 

(2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to applications relating to a noncommercial performance studies. 

(3) The National Office may recover, as a simple contract debt in any 
court of competent jurisdiction, from the person by whom it is payable, 
any amount due and owing to it as a fee payable under this Regulation.”.

title: of giving further effect to Regulation EU 2017/746 of the European Parliament
heading: 5. The European Union (National Research Ethics Committees for
text_raw:
5. The European Union (National Research Ethics Committees for 
Performance Studies of In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 725 of 2022) are revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 December, 2023. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health.

title: of giving further effect to Regulation EU 2017/746 of the European Parliament
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (National Research Ethics 
Committees for Performance Studies of In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices) 
Regulations 2022. 

These Regulations also revoke European Union (National Research Ethics 
Committees for Performance Studies of In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 725 of 2022). 

They amend the amount of fees payable in respect of applications for National 
Research Ethics Committee (“National REC”) review of a performance study 
to be conducted in the State or for a National REC review of a substantial 
modification of a performance study and appeals in respect of such 
applications. In particular, these Regulations remove fees for applications relating to 
non-commercial performance studies.
